p: The ECSA-genotype CHIKV strain CP10 was isolated during a 2010 outbreak in Thailand [ 30, 31]; Asian-genotype strains ARUBA-15801125 (NCBI Accession Number LC500216), ARUBA-15800567 (LC500220), and ARUBA-15801654 (LC500221) were isolated from the sera of patients in Aruba [ 27, 32, 33]. Sindbis virus (SINV; strain R68), another alphavirus, was propagated in BHK cells. CHIKV strains were propagated using Vero and C6/36 cells. For viral titration, a standard plaque assay was performed [ 34].
